article.headline: Jacksonville 65, S.C.-Upstate 52
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. -- Ben Smith had 15 points and seven assists and Jacksonville rallied to defeat South Carolina-Upstate 65-52 on Saturday for the Dolphins' seventh straight win. The Spartans (3-16, 3-7 Atlantic Sun Conference), who snapped Jacksonville's nine-game winning streak last year, went into halftime ahead 29-22 by shooting 58.5 percent from the field (10-for-17). The Dolphins (10-8, 7-3), coming off their worst shooting performance of the season against North Florida at 27.4 percent (17-for-62), shot only 24.1 percent (7-for-29) in the first half. Jacksonville improved to 51.9 percent (14-for-27) in the second half, outscoring the Spartans 43-23. Jacksonville held S.C.-Upstate to two points in the first 7:10 while pulling ahead 38-31. After the Spartans closed to 40-37, Jacksonville responded with seven straight points. Pat Posey led S.C.-Upstate with 15 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
